intro: Beguea tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Tsaratanana beguea, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the high-altitude rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from deforestation, Beguea tsaratananensis is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
